workflow.name: Ai-driven Instagram reels creation and publishing with GPT, Creatomate and Slack
workflow.description:
Automate your Instagram growth strategy by generating and posting viral Reels using AI and Creatomate. This workflow plans content topics based on trends, generates video assets, and handles the approval and posting process‚Äîall without manual video editing.

## How it works

1. **Schedule Trigger**: Runs every day at 9:00 AM.
2. **Topic Planning**: Checks past topics from Google Sheets to avoid duplicates, then uses OpenAI (GPT-4o) to generate a new quiz-style content plan.
3. **Video Generation**: Uses Creatomate to generate a video based on a template, dynamically inserting the AI-generated text and images.
4. **Approval Loop**: Sends the generated video to Slack for human review.
5. **Posting**: Once approved in Slack, the workflow automatically uploads the Reel to Instagram.
6. **Logging**: Saves the new topic to Google Sheets and notifies Slack upon successful publication.

## Setup steps

1. **Configure Credentials**:
   - **OpenAI**: For generating content plans.
   - **Creatomate**: For video rendering.
   - **Google Sheets**: For tracking past topics.
   - **Slack**: For approval notifications.
   - **Facebook Graph API**: For Instagram publishing.

2. **Google Sheets Setup**:
   - Create a Google Sheet with columns: `Question`, `Answer`, `Title`, `Date`.
   - Update the **Get Past Topics** and **Save New Topic** nodes with your Sheet ID.

3. **Creatomate Setup**:
   - Create a template in Creatomate or use an existing one.
   - Update the **Generate Video** node with your `template_id` in the JSON body.

4. **Slack Setup**:
   - Create a channel for approvals.
   - Update the **Slack Approval Request** and **Slack Notification** nodes with your Channel ID.

5. **Activate**:
   - Turn on the workflow to start automating your content pipeline!

parameters.content:
# üöÄ Automated Instagram Reels Generator

## How it works
AI plans a "viral" Reel based on trends and generates it using Creatomate.

## Setup steps
1. Configure Credentials for OpenAI, Creatomate, Google Sheets, Slack, and Facebook.
2. Set up your Google Sheet and Slack Channel IDs in the respective nodes.
3. Configure the Creatomate Template ID.

## 1. Content Planning & Approval
Generates ideas based on trends using AI and requests human approval via Slack.

## 2. Video Creation
Transform the accepted plan into a video using Creatomate.

parameters.text:
=You are a professional Instagram marketer aiming to grow followers to 1000. Create accurate quiz-style content about n8n automation. The target audience is tech-savvy users who are beginners in automation. Follow these strict requirements and output in JSON format suitable for the Creatomate template. Provide clear and accurate information.

## Past Topics (Do not duplicate)
{{ $('Get Past Topics').all().map(item => item.json.Question).join(', ') }}

## Constraints (Strict)
1. **JSON Output Only:** Return only raw JSON text. No explanation or Markdown code blocks.
2. **Language:** Write in Japanese (as per original intent for content) OR English? -> User said "Translate node names and parameters to English". Usually templates should generate English content by default unless specified otherwise. I will switch the content generation to **English** for the template to be global-friendly.
3. **Length:** `Answer.text` should be within 50 chars for mobile readability.

## Output Fields
1. **Image-R6B.source**:
   - English prompt for an abstract, cool background image representing the node function.
   - Keywords: "Abstract technology background, dark blue, n8n style, 3d render" + specific elements.
2. **Audio-PTX.trim_start**:
   - Numeric `6.5` (Fixed)
3. **Question.text**:
   - Line 1: Node Name (English)
   - Line 2: Two newlines `\n\n` then a short question.
   - Example: "Sticky Note\n\nWhat is the surprising use of this node?"
4. **Answer.text**:
   - Explain function/benefit briefly.
   - Must include one `\n\n` to split into 2 lines.
5. **Title.text**:
   - String "n8n Quiz" (Fixed)
6. **Title.font_family**:
   - String "Inter" or "Roboto" (Changed from Noto Sans JP for English template compatibility)

## Output Example
{
  "Image-R6B.source": "Abstract technology background...",
  "Audio-PTX.trim_start": 6.5,
  "Question.text": "Guardrails\n\nWhat does this node do?",
  "Answer.text": "Monitors AI I/O for safety.\n\nPrevents prompt injection.",
  "Title.text": "n8n Quiz",
  "Title.font_family": "Inter"
}

parameters.content:
## 3. Publishing
Uploads and publishes the reel to Instagram automatically.

user.name: Shun Nakayama
user.bio: Founder of Human Beings Inc. | Automation Specialist Specializing in n8n workflows and AI integration to streamline business processes. I help companies save time and focus on what matters.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
